=You are a contract data extraction agent for music publishing agreements. Extract information into JSON matching the provided schema. ## TOOLS & USAGE RULES **Available Tools:** - 'search_organization': Find publisher/administrator name and UUID (call max 2x total) - 'search_person': Find writer/songwriter name and UUID (call max 1x) **Critical Rules:** 1. Call each tool ONCE per entity - if no results, set number=null and continue 2. Search ONLY: publisher company, administrator (if different), primary writer (person, not company) 3. DO NOT search: attorneys, managers, agents, secondary writers, company reps 4. Extract only explicitly stated information - use null for missing data 5. Return ONLY valid JSON - no markdown, no explanations ## FIELD EXTRACTION REFERENCE | Field | Look For | Format | |-------|----------|--------| | **execution_date** | "Executed as of", signature dates, "IN WITNESS WHEREOF" | YYYY-MM-DD | | **status** | Signature status | "Fully Executed" if all signed | | **publishing_deal_type** | "co-publishing" / "50%" split = Co-Publishing
"administration" / "admin fee" / "writer retains 100%" = Administration | enum | | **territories** | Specific countries listed | array or null | | **is_worldwide** | "worldwide", "universe", "throughout the world" | true/false | | **reversion_period** | Years until rights revert | number | | **reversion_type** | Type of reversion clause | enum | ### TERMS ARRAY **Initial Term (index=0):** Extract all details from document **Option Periods (index≥1):** - Look for: "option to extend", "First/Second Option Period", "renewal term" - Extract: New advance amounts, any explicitly changed fields - Inherit: All unspecified fields copy from previous term - Set: term_status = "Pending" for options | Term Field | Look For | Format | |------------|----------|--------| | **term_length** | Duration value | integer | | **term_length_type** | Years/Months/Date | enum | | **delivery_requirement_basis** | "Minimum Delivery", "MDC", "shall deliver" | Albums/Compositions/Releases | | **delivery_requirement_units** | Number to deliver | integer | | **currency** | $ = USD, € = EUR, etc. | enum | | **advance** | Advance amount (no symbols) | number | | **payment_schedule** | When advance is paid | string | | **performance_split** | % of performance income | decimal (0.50 = 50%) | | **sync_split** | % of sync income | decimal | | **mechanical_split** | % of mechanical income (phonorecords/transcriptions) | decimal | | **other_pub_split** | % of other publishing income | decimal | | **composition_agreements** | Always empty | [] | **Royalty Splits:** Convert percentages to decimals: 50% = 0.50, 75% = 0.75, 0.25% = 0.0025 Express publishing splits in terms of the publisher's split, i.e. if publisher credits writer with 75% of sync, set this field to 25%. ### ENTITY MATCHING **Publisher:** 1. Extract company name from document header/signature - extract only the core publisher name, keep it brief.(e.g., 'SONY/ATV TUNES'). 2. Call `search_organizations(name, org_type="Publisher")` ONCE 3. If match found: use name and number from results 4. If no match: use document name, set number=null 5. STOP **Administrator (only if different from publisher):** 1. If same as publisher → set to null, skip search 2. If different → call `search_organizations(name, org_type="Publisher")` ONCE 3. Match/no match logic same as publisher 4. STOP **Person (primary writer only):** 1. Extract writer name (individual, not company) from "Writer" section/signature 2. Call `search_person(full_name)` ONCE 3. If match found: use name and number from results 4. If no match: use document name, set number=null 5. STOP - do not search other names ## OUTPUT Return complete JSON immediately. All required fields must be present. Use null for missing data.

# EXCLUSIVE SONGWRITER AND CO-PUBLISHING AGREEMENT 

THIS AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") is made and entered into as of May 7, 2024, by and between 1916 Enterprises 2.0, LLC, c/o Todd Rubenstein Law, Inc., 1645 N. Vine St., Suite 809, Los Angeles, CA 90028, or its publishing company designee ("1916"), and SEVS MUSIC ENTERTAINMENT, INC., c/o Law Office of Jeffrey B. Gandel, 1623 Third Ave, Suite 22A New York, NY 10128, or its publishing company designee ("SEVS") (1916 and SEVS shall be referred to herein collectively as "Publisher"), on the one hand, and Olivia Kiene, individually and on behalf of each and every of her publishing company designees and any Affiliate thereof, including, without limitation, her publishing company designee OLIVIAJKIENE (ASCAP), c/o Rothenberg, Mohr \& Binder, LLP, 9595, Wilshire Blvd., Suite 201, Beverly Hills, CA 90212, Attn: Lisa M. Lester, Esq. (jointly and severally, "Grantor" or "Writer"), on the other hand.

For and in consideration of the mutual covenants herein set forth, the parties hereby agree as follows:

## A. DEFINITIONS:

In this Agreement the following terms shall bear the following meanings:
"Affiliate" - any Person which Grantor or Publisher now or hereafter owns or controls, in whole or in part. Hereinafter, any Affiliate of Publisher shall be referred to as a "Publisher Affiliate."
"Acquired Composition(s)" - all of the musical compositions (in addition to the New Compositions or the Old Compositions) in which Writer and/or Grantor or any Affiliates of Writer and/or Grantor acquire or have acquired any ownership, control or administration interest during or prior to the Term, are hereinafter called "Acquired Compositions."
"Composition" - a musical composition written by Writer, owned, controlled in whole or in part prior to and/or during the Term by Grantor and/or Writer, or the fractional equivalent thereof (i.e., a Composition hereunder shall only be deemed to be that portion of a musical composition derived from Writer's creative share of such musical composition; provided a "Whole Composition" means one [1] or more Compositions which, in the aggregate, equal one hundred percent [ $100 \%$ ] creative share) and shall include the corresponding worldwide copyrights and any renewals or extensions thereof under any present or future laws, causes of action related thereto, the titles, lyrics and music thereof, right to copyright the same and all other rights now known or hereafter created relating thereto and shall include the Existing Compositions and any New Compositions, as defined herein, but specifically exclude any Acquired Compositions.
"Deliver," "Delivered" or "Delivery" - a Composition shall be deemed "Delivered" to Publisher only upon Publisher's actual receipt of: (i) a satisfactory demonstration recording (a "Demo") or, if applicable, a commercially released recording, in .WAV or other digital (e.g. MP3) format or any other format reasonably requested or otherwise approved by Publisher suitable for filing in the Copyright Office; (ii) a complete list of the names, performing rights organization information, and contact information of all songwriters (including the Grantor) and co-publishers

of the applicable Composition, the respective percentages of each songwriter and publisher with respect to such Composition and any song split letters; (iii) a complete lyric sheet of such Composition; (iv) executed assignments of copyright and authorizations in the form of Exhibits "A" and "B;" (v) all reasonably necessary information, consents, licenses and permissions, (e.g., sampling clearances) such that Publisher may acquire and protect all copyrights herein acquired by Publisher in and to the Compositions and perfect such rights; (vi) notice to Publisher identifying any and all so-called "samples" in compliance with subparagraph 3.01(b), and (vii) if the Composition has been recorded and is to be released, notice to Publisher of the anticipated scheduled U.S. release date for the applicable Composition (if known to Grantor) and the applicable mechanical royalty rates.

"Exploited Composition" - a Composition that has been Commercially Exploited (defined in paragraph 5.02(b) below).

"Gross Receipts" - all monies received by Publisher from all sources worldwide (or credited to Publisher's account in reduction of an advance in which Grantor did not share), including without limitation sums received as a result of any litigation settlement net of actual, documented, bona fide out of pocket third party costs incurred with respect to the underlying claims resulting in such settlement together with a pro-rata share of unallocated license fees paid by third parties in respect of Publisher's catalog incapable of being recouped (i.e., so-called "breakage"). To the extent that any third party or parties engaged by Publisher to exercise rights in the Compositions (for example, administrators or sub-publishers) retain any portion of such monies, the portion so retained shall be included as Gross Receipts hereunder. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, and for the avoidance of doubt, for purposes of the applicable calculations hereunder, the actual, out-of-pocket sub-publisher/administrator fees charged by Publisher's sub-publishers and/or outside administrators shall not exceed (x) fifteen percent (15%) with respect to mechanical, print and other income in the United States (twenty percent [20%] outside of the United States); (y) thirty percent (30%) with respect to the publisher's share of public performance (forty percent [40%] outside of the United States); and (z) twenty percent (20%) for synchronization licenses and/or covers/co-writes verifiably procured by the applicable sub-publisher/administrator.

"Minimum Time Commitment" - for the Contract Period, that period commencing as of the first day of the Contract Period and ending on the date three (3) years following commencement of the applicable Contract Period.

"Name and Likeness Materials" - Writer's professional name (heretofore or hereafter adopted by Writer and approved for use by Writer), Writer's legal name in connection with songwriter credit, Writer's approved photograph or other approved likeness, or any approved reproduction or simulation thereof (collectively the "Name and Likeness Materials").

"Net Receipts" - Gross Receipts derived from the exploitation of Compositions, actually received by Publisher or its Publisher Affiliates in the United States (or credited to Publisher's account in reduction of an advance in which Grantor did not share), subject to paragraph 10.02, less all actual, out-of-pocket, third party amounts Publisher is permitted to deduct from such Gross Receipts pursuant to the terms of this Agreement, expressly including, without limitation, the following: (i) royalties due to co-publishers, co-writers and any other

1916.Sevs.Kiene.CoPubAgmt.1-3.docx


2

royalty participant entitled to a share of such income, if any; (ii) Intentionally Omitted; (iii) bona-fide, verifiable actual out of pocket fees payable to any independent third party agents engaged by Publisher (and mutually approved by Grantor and Publisher) who are engaged to procure synchs or other uses of the Compositions; (iv) taxes withheld at the source of the income (e.g., foreign withholding taxes and VAT, but excluding income tax); (v) copyright registration fees actually incurred by Publisher; (vi) the actual, out-of-pocket costs of preparing lead sheets, and other actual, documented out of pocket administration expenses (excluding overhead/staff expenses); (vii) reasonable, documented out-of-pocket third party audit and litigation collection expenses; (viii) actual bona-fide and verifiable out of pocket third party local collection, performing rights or other society fees (or an equivalent amount to be retained by Publisher); (ix) actual documented, out-of-pocket, third party fees associated with the creation and/or procurement of foreign language translations or new foreign lyrics solely to the extent required by the applicable local society rules or regulations; (x) any other actual bona-fide and verifiable out-of-pocket outside third party expenses (excluding general overhead expenses, rent and salaries) directly related to and reasonably necessary for the collection of income hereunder or the exercise of Publisher's rights hereunder not otherwise deducted hereunder; and (xi) actual, bona fide fees payable to or retained by administrators, subpublishers and third party agencies, which are directly and identifiably attributable to the exploitation of the Compositions.

"Person" - a natural person or a partnership, joint venture, corporation, association or other entity of any kind and their successors and representatives.

"Pipeline Monies" - Publisher's reasonable, good faith estimate of Grantor's share of Net Receipts (as defined herein) that have been received by or credited to Publisher or its subpublisher/administrator in the United States, or Publisher's foreign Publisher Affiliates, or credited to Publisher against an advance previously received by Publisher and in which Grantor did not share, but not yet credited to Grantor's royalty account.

"Term" - the period specified in paragraph 2 below, as the same may be extended pursuant to the terms hereof.

"Territory" - the Universe.

1. SERVICES:

1.01 During the Term (hereinafter defined) and any renewals or extension(s) thereof, Grantor's interest derived from Writer's authorship and/or composing of musical compositions and the results and proceeds thereof shall be exclusive to Publisher in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

2. TERM; TERRITORY:

2.01 (a) (i) The term of this Agreement (the "Term") begins as of the date hereof and shall consist of an initial period ("Initial Period") and one (1) consecutive successive option period if Publisher exercises its option to extend the Term (the "Option Period") pursuant to paragraph 2.01(b) below. The Initial Period and Option Period, if applicable, may

1916.Sevs.Kiene.CoPubAgmt.1-3.docx

3

each be referred to herein as a "Contract Period." The Initial Period will commence on the date of this Agreement and the Option Period, if exercised, shall commence immediately upon the expiration of the Initial Period. Subject to the option warning procedure set forth in paragraph 2.01(b)(ii) below, each Contract Period shall endure until the later of (A) the expiration of the Minimum Time Commitment or (B) the day on which Publisher has paid or credited to Grantor's account royalties (including Publisher's reasonable, good faith estimate of Pipeline Monies) equaling one hundred percent ( $100 \%$ ) of the aggregate Advances (as defined below) paid to Grantor during the applicable Contract Period (the "Recoupment Amount").
(ii) Intentionally Omitted.
(ii) Intentionally Omitted.
(iii) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, if (A) Intentionally Omitted; or (B) as of the last day of the accounting period immediately during which the three (3) year anniversary of the commencement of the Option Period occurs (as applicable), Publisher has credited to Grantor's account less than the Recoupment Amount (including Publisher's reasonable, good faith estimate of Pipeline Monies), then Grantor shall have the right to pay to Publisher an amount equal to one hundred twenty percent ( $120 \%$ ) of the difference between the Recoupment Amount and the royalties credited to Grantor during such Contract Period as of the date of such payment (including Pipeline Monies) (the "Repayment Amount"); and subject to paragraph 2.01(b)(ii) below, the Contract Period shall expire on the date upon which the Repayment Amount is paid to Publisher or the end of such three (3) year period, as applicable.
(b) (i) Publisher may exercise its option to extend the Term of this Agreement for the Option Period by giving Grantor written notice no later than thirty (30) days prior to the date of expiration of the Initial Period.
(ii) Notwithstanding the foregoing or anything to the contrary herein contained, if Publisher fails to timely exercise its option to extend the Term for the Option Period before the thirty (30)-day notice date as referenced above (the "Option Exercise Date"), the then-current Contract Period will automatically be extended, subject to the following option warning procedure. If, after the Option Exercise Date, Grantor delivers to Publisher written notice of Publisher's failure to exercise the Option Period, and Publisher fails to notify Grantor in writing within thirty (30) days after Publisher's receipt of such notice (the "Option Warning Period") that Publisher exercises its option to extend the Term hereof for the applicable Option Period, then the Term of this Agreement shall automatically expire as of the end of the Option Warning Period. If Publisher shall so exercise its option, then, at the end of the Option Warning Period, the Initial Period shall expire and the Option Period shall commence.
(c) Intentionally Omitted.
(d) For the avoidance of doubt, the expiration or termination of the Term of this Agreement shall not affect any of Publisher's rights of ownership, copyright, co-publication or administration with respect to Compositions, or any of Publisher's obligations with respect

to the Compositions (including, without limitation, Publisher's obligation to account to Grantor), subject to this Agreement on the end date of the Term, all of which rights and obligations shall continue after such expiration or termination in accordance with the provisions of this Agreement.

3. **DELIVERY:**

3.01 (a) During the Term, Grantor shall Deliver all Compositions to Publisher promptly after Grantor writes any particular Composition(s), including, without limitation, all Existing Compositions. The Compositions may, at Publisher's option, be registered for copyright in the names of Publisher, Grantor, Writer and/or Grantor's publishing company designee (as applicable) in the office of the Register of Copyrights of the United States of America in accordance with Publisher's (or Publisher's sub-publisher's/administrator's) policy in effect from time to time.

(b) Upon Delivery of any Demo embodying a sample, Grantor shall serve written notice upon Publisher (for which email shall suffice, provided Publisher's attorney shall be copied on any such email correspondence) fully identifying any samples contained in any such Demo and/or the Composition embodied therein, it being understood and agreed that, for purposes of this provision, "samples" shall be understood to include, without limitation, any use of any pre-existing musical composition (or any portions thereof), or any use of any pre-existing sound recording (or any portions thereof), regardless of duration. Grantor's notice hereunder shall include Grantor's representation and warranty to Publisher that all information as to samples is exhaustive and accurate in all respects. As between Publisher and Grantor, Grantor shall be solely responsible for obtaining sample clearances in a manner reasonably satisfactory to Publisher in respect of any sample embodied in a Composition subject to this Agreement, provided, however, that Publisher may, in its reasonable discretion, directly settle the clearance of any sampled material, with Grantor having an opportunity for meaningful consultation in connection therewith and approval with respect to any reduction of copyright not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed, provided that any out-of-pocket third party costs actually incurred by Publisher in connection therewith shall be deemed advances recoupable from royalties payable to Grantor hereunder (excluding the so-called "writer's share" of public performance royalties).

(c) If Grantor collaborates with any other Person in the creation of any Composition(s), Grantor's interest in such Composition shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

4. **MINIMUM DELIVERY COMMITMENT:**

4.01 During each Contract Period, Grantor shall Deliver to Publisher no fewer than five (5) New Compositions (or the fractional equivalent thereof) (Grantor's "Minimum Delivery Commitment").

4.02 Grantor shall Deliver all Compositions hereunder promptly following the completion of each such Composition.

4.03 The Minimum Delivery Commitment shall only be deemed fulfilled when Grantor has

notified Publisher of such fulfillment, including, if applicable, specifying the Composition(s), and any other information reasonably requested by Publisher.

4.04 In order to apply in reduction of Grantor's Minimum Delivery Commitment, a New Composition must satisfy all of the following requirements: (i) the New Composition is newly created by Grantor during the applicable Contract Period; (ii) the New Composition is of a quality commensurate with Grantor's prior works; (iii) the New Composition is copyrightable; and (iv) the New Composition is owned and controlled solely by Grantor (subject to Publisher's ownership rights and interests as specified in this Agreement) and Publisher is entitled to recoup Advances from Grantor's entire publisher's and songwriter's share of royalties (with the exception of Writer's songwriter's share of public performance royalties that Writer receives directly from the applicable performing rights society); provided, however, that if Grantor writes and composes less than one hundred percent (100%) of any New Composition, then the fractional portion of such New Composition that is controlled hereunder shall be credited towards fulfillment of Grantor's Minimum Delivery Commitment. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein, if a New Composition contains any samplings of any other musical composition, approval for each such sampling and resolution of all shares relating to each such sampling must be secured by Grantor from the owner of any such sampled musical compositions, in writing and at Grantor's own expense (provided, however, that Publisher will provide reasonable customary assistance regarding such sampling), before such New Composition can be accepted hereunder. In no event shall an arrangement of a composition in the public domain count as any portion of a New Composition.

4.05 If Grantor fails to fulfill all or any portion of Grantor's Minimum Delivery Commitment within Minimum Time Commitment, Publisher shall have the following options: (i) upon written notice to Grantor, to suspend Publisher's obligations to make Advance payments under this Agreement until Grantor has cured the default; (ii) upon written notice to Grantor, to terminate the Term at any time before the date on which Grantor has fully cured the default; and (iii) upon written notice to Grantor, to waive fulfillment of all or part of the Minimum Delivery Commitment for the Contract Period concerned. If Publisher terminates the Term under the foregoing clause (ii), all parties shall be deemed to have fulfilled all of their respective obligations under this Agreement except those obligations that survive the end of the Term (e.g., payment of royalties, warranties, representations, indemnities, etc.). No exercise of an option under this subparagraph shall limit Publisher's rights to recover damages by reason of Grantor's default, or Publisher's rights to exercise any other option under this Agreement, or any of Publisher's other rights.

5. ASSIGNMENT TO PUBLISHER; ADMINISTRATION:

5.01 (a) Grantor and Writer hereby irrevocably assign and grant to Publisher and its successors and assigns, for the Territory, for the life of copyright (including any and all extensions and renewals), subject to paragraph 5.02(b) below, fifty percent (50%) of its right, title and interest in and to (i) Compositions presently owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by Grantor or any music publishing company or other entity owned or controlled by Grantor that are written by Writer including, without limitation, those Compositions listed on Schedule "A" attached hereto, and any other Composition written, owned and/or controlled in whole or in part by Grantor or Writer, directly or indirectly, prior to the Term hereof ("Existing Compositions"), which Grantor shall use good faith efforts to deliver to

Publisher not later than thirty (30) days following execution of this Agreement, provided that in the event of Grantor's inadvertent failure to comply with the foregoing, such Compositions shall be deemed New Compositions; and (ii) Compositions which are written, composed or created by Writer during the Term, in whole or in part, alone or in collaboration with others or directly or indirectly owned, and controlled during the Term by Grantor or any music publishing company or other entity owned or controlled by Grantor ("New Compositions"). For the avoidance of doubt, the grant of rights set forth in this paragraph 5.01(a) shall not apply to any Acquired Compositions. To the extent that Grantor's interests in any musical composition previously assigned to a third party revert to Grantor, then any such reverted interests shall be deemed Existing Compositions hereunder. Grantor hereby waives and hereby causes Writer to waive in favor of Publisher and Publisher's successors, licensees and assigns, all of Grantor's and Writer's moral rights and droites de suite in the Compositions in each territory of the world to the full extent same may be waived. For the avoidance of doubt, each musical composition which is written, composed and/or created in whole or in part by Writer prior to and/or during the Term, alone or in collaboration with other songwriters, but completed within one (1) month after the expiration of the Term, shall be deemed written, composed and/or created (as applicable) during the Term and fully subject to all terms and provisions of this Agreement.
(b) Grantor shall, within ten (10) business days of Publisher's request, or as soon as practical, execute a separate letter of assignment in respect of each Composition acquired by Publisher under this Agreement in the form of Exhibit "A" hereto, and a letter of notification in the form of Exhibit "B" hereto, it being agreed that should Grantor fail to do so in any instance(s), Publisher is hereby granted an irrevocable limited power of attorney solely to execute same in Grantor's name, on Grantor's behalf, as Grantor's limited attorney in fact. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Grantor shall be given the first opportunity to sign any such documents with respect to which a power of attorney applies, but if Publisher does not receive any such signed document within ten (10) business days of Publisher's written request therefor (for which email shall suffice), Publisher shall have the right to sign such document on Grantor's behalf. Copies of all such documents signed by Publisher on Grantor's behalf pursuant to this paragraph 5 shall be provided to Grantor, provided that Publisher's nonconsecutively repetitive, inadvertent failure to do so shall not be a breach of this Agreement.
(c) Intentionally Omitted.

# 5.02 Publisher's Exclusive Administration Rights: 

(a) Subject to paragraphs 5.02(b) and 5.02(c) below, Grantor hereby irrevocably grants to Publisher, its successors, licensees, sub-licensees, and assigns, the sole and exclusive right to administer one hundred percent ( $100 \%$ ) of the so-called "writer's share" (provided, however, that such rights shall exclude the so-called "writer's share" of public performance income) and one hundred percent ( $100 \%$ ) of the so-called "publisher's share" of the Compositions throughout the Territory for the life of the copyright and all renewals and extensions thereof, including, without limitation, the following exclusive rights:
(i) To collect and receive any and all monies which have accrued or which may accrue with respect thereto (excluding the so-called "writer's share" of public performance royalties paid directly by the performing rights societies);

(ii) To perform the Compositions publicly, whether for profit or otherwise, by means of public or private performance, radio broadcast or otherwise (including on radio, television, internet and all other media now known or hereafter devised);

(iii) To mechanically reproduce the Compositions in any and all physical, digital or other formats (whether now known or hereafter invented);

(iv) To grant the right to distribute the Compositions in any and all physical and digital formats or other format (whether now known or hereafter invented);

(v) To grant worldwide licenses for the recording and use of the Compositions in and with motion pictures, television productions, Internet-based productions, software, videograms, commercials or any and all other present or future technologies;

(vi) To authorize dramatizations of the Compositions, without limitation, including so-called "grand" performing rights;

(vii) To issue mechanical licenses including, without limitation, so-called "first-use" mechanical licenses;

(viii) To issue mechanical licenses in the U.S and Canada at not less than 75% of the then current statutory rate, except in those circumstances where such reduced rate licenses are customarily issued;

(ix) To authorize samples and interpolations of the Compositions and the use of Composition titles;

(x) To cause new lyrics to be written in foreign languages provided that in no event will Publisher authorize a reduction in solely Grantor's share as a result of any such foreign translation (i.e., such reduction will come off the top) except to the extent such reduction is required pursuant to the rules of the mechanical and/or performance society in an applicable foreign territory;

(xi) To secure copyright registration and protection of the Compositions throughout the Territory, including, without limitation, registration with any mechanical and/or performance society, in the joint names of Publisher, Writer, Grantor and Grantor's publishing company designee, including any and all renewals, reversions, and extensions of copyrights; in connection with the foregoing, Publisher agrees to use reasonable efforts to register Compositions with such mechanical and/or performance societies and to notify Publisher's applicable sub-publishers/administrators to do the same, provided that Grantor has provided Publisher with complete and accurate information relating to the Compositions as may be reasonably required by such societies and/or sub-publishers/administrators to enable registration, but in any event including at least the title, share, names of all co-writers, co-writer's applicable share, and co-writer's applicable publishing designee and/or administrator (if any);

1916.Sevs.Kiene.CoPubAgmt.1-3.docx

8

(xii) To print, publish, and sell sheet music, orchestrations, arrangements, and other editions of the Compositions in all forms (including digital), with or without music;

(xiii) To authorize, in good faith, the exploitation of any and all other rights now or hereafter existing in all Compositions and in any configuration or technology whether now known or hereafter conceived or developed under and by virtue of any common law rights and all copyrights and renewals and extensions thereof including, but not limited to, the right to license the use of the Compositions in merchandising activities; and

(xiv) To grant any and all of said rights to others on behalf of Publisher and Grantor, provided that Grantor's royalties shall be calculated and credited subject always to paragraph 9 below and provided that such third parties agree to the restrictions set forth herein.

(b) **Reversion of Rights:**

(i) (A) Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in this Agreement, Grantor shall have the right to cause the reversion to Grantor of any and all Compositions, including, without limitation, any and all rights therein and thereto, which have not been Commercially Exploited (defined below), prior to the Unexploited Reversion Notice Date (the "Unexploited Compositions") by written notice to Publisher on or after the last day of the semi-annual accounting period following the three (3) year anniversary of the expiration or termination of the Term (the "Unexploited Reversion Notice Date"). For the purposes of this paragraph 5.02(b)(i)(A), a Composition shall be deemed "Commercially Exploited" if it has generated Gross Receipts of at least Seven Hundred Fifty Dollars ($750) (or a pro-rata share thereof if the applicable Composition has been co-written by Writer and one [1] or more other songwriters) and that income has been received by Publisher during the Term or prior to the Unexploited Reversion Notice Date (as applicable).

(B) Publisher shall have no further interest in Unexploited Compositions following the Unexploited Reversion Notice Date and Publisher shall execute such documents as Grantor reasonably requests in writing to evidence the rights in any Composition which have reverted to Grantor in accordance with the terms of this paragraph, it being agreed that should Publisher fail to do so in any instance, Grantor is hereby granted an irrevocable power of attorney solely to execute same in Publisher's name, on Publisher's behalf, as Publisher's limited attorney in fact. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Publisher shall be given the first opportunity to sign any such documents with respect to which a power of attorney applies, but if Grantor does not receive any such signed document within ten (10) business days of Grantor's written request therefore (for which email shall suffice), Grantor shall have the right to sign such document on Publisher's behalf. Copies of all such documents signed by Grantor on Publisher's behalf pursuant to this paragraph shall be provided to Publisher, provided that Grantor's non-consecutively repetitive, inadvertent failure to do so shall not be a breach of this Agreement.

(ii) (A) Grantor shall have the right to cause the reversion to Grantor of the administration rights assigned to Publisher hereunder in and to Grantor's retained aggregate fifty percent (50%) share of the copyrights in the Exploited Compositions and the right to collect any income related thereto and one hundred percent (100%) of the so-called "writer's share" of royalties in connection with Compositions throughout the Territory, at any

time after the last day of the semi-annual accounting period following the seventh ( $7^{\text {th }}$ ) anniversary of the end of the Term ("Reversion Notice Date"). To cause the reversion provided for above, following the Reversion Notice Date, Grantor shall give Publisher written notice of Grantor's desire that Grantor's retained aggregate fifty percent ( $50 \%$ ) share of the copyrights in the Compositions and the right to collect any income related thereto and one hundred percent ( $100 \%$ ) of the so-called "writer's share" of royalties in connection with Compositions revert ("Reversion Notice"), which notice shall be effective at the end of the accounting period in which the Reversion Notice is validly given ("Admin Reversion Date"). The period commencing as of the expiration of the Term and expiring as of the Reversion Date may be referred to herein as the "Admin Retention Period." Furthermore, neither party shall be deemed in default hereunder if such party's performance of its obligations hereunder is delayed or becomes impossible or impractical, or Publisher is materially hampered in the exploitation and/or administration of the Compositions, by reason of any act of God; war; fire; earthquake; strike; sickness; accident; civil commotion; epidemic; act of government, its agencies or officers; failure of computer facilities; loss of books and/or records; or any other legitimate cause beyond such party's control (each a "Force Majeure Event"), provided, for the avoidance of doubt, that Publisher shall continue to render such services as it is able to notwithstanding such Force Majeure Event (e.g., if royalty collection and accounting is not impacted, royalties shall continue to be collected and accounted), and in the event that such Force Majeure Event continues for longer than six (6) months, Grantor shall have the right to terminate the Term of this Agreement upon written notice to Publisher (email shall suffice), subject to repayment of the Repayment Amount. Furthermore, Publisher shall not be required to pay any Advance which may be or become due, but which has not yet been paid, in the event of death or incapacitation of Grantor which precludes Writer from performing material services hereunder.
11.03 Publisher and its duly appointed representatives are hereby empowered (but not obligated) and are hereby irrevocably appointed limited attorney in fact on an exclusive basis

to prosecute and defend all suits and actions and generally to do and perform all things necessary or desirable in or about the Compositions and the copyrights therein and thereto and in any derivative copyrights (specifically excluding master recordings [except with respect to demo recordings owned by Publisher) in the name of Publisher and Grantor (or in the name of Publisher's duly appointed representative together with that of Grantor), to prevent and restrain infringement of the said copyrights, to protect and enforce the said copyrights and if there shall have been any infringement or any unauthorized use thereof prior to the date of this Agreement to prosecute any action in respect thereof, and to take all such steps as Publisher shall deem expedient or desirable in the exercise of its reasonable business judgment to protect the right, title and interest of Publisher in and to each of the Compositions, and every portion thereof, including, without limitation, the right to initiate an audit of any third party licensee (e.g., any record label whom Publisher may have the right to audit), provided that any disposition of rights, titles or interests in and to any Composition shall be subject to Grantor's prior written approval. Grantor shall have the right, at Grantor's own expense, to participate as plaintiff in any such action brought by Publisher hereunder. Any monies received by Publisher by way of audit, settlement or judgment, after deduction of reasonable outside attorney fees, actual court costs, certified public accountant fees and all other bona-fide, documented, out-of-pocket, third party expenses incurred in respect of actions initiated by Publisher hereunder, shall be divided between Publisher and Grantor in accordance with the applicable royalty provision of paragraph 9 hereinabove. Grantor shall have the right to approve any settlement or compromise of any action that relates to any Composition, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed. If Publisher refuses or fails to pursue a claim, Grantor may advise Publisher of Grantor's desire to pursue such claim, and if Publisher does not pursue such claim within thirty (30) days of Grantor's notice to Publisher (or such shorter period as the exigencies of circumstances require), Grantor shall have the right to pursue such claim, provided that any monies received by Grantor in connection therewith shall, after deduction of reasonable out-of-pocket attorney fees, court costs and all other expenses reasonably incurred in respect of such claim or action, be divided between Publisher and Grantor in accordance with the applicable royalty provision of paragraph 9 hereinabove.

12.01 (a) Grantor hereby indemnifies, saves and holds Publisher, its successors and assigns, harmless from any and all third party liability, claims, demands, loss and damage (including reasonable outside counsel fees and court costs actually incurred) arising out of any breach by Grantor of the warranties, representations or agreements made by Grantor in this Agreement which is reduced to final adverse judgment in a court of competent jurisdiction or settled with Grantor's prior written consent, not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed (such approval not to be required for any settlement of Five Thousand Dollars [$5,000] or less). Grantor shall reimburse Publisher, on demand, for any loss, cost, expense or damage to which said indemnity applies, failing which, Publisher may reimburse itself for monies paid or incurred by Publisher in connection therewith from Grantor's royalties. Pending the disposition of any such claim or action, Publisher shall have the right to withhold payment of such portion of any monies which may be payable by Publisher to Grantor under this Agreement (excluding the so-called "writer's share" of public performance royalties) as shall be reasonably related to the amount of the claim and estimated outside counsel fees and actual, out-of-pocket costs, provided that if no suit is filed and no settlement negotiations are pending

within one (1) year after Publisher receives notice of a particular claim, then upon notice from Grantor to Publisher that such one (1) year period has expired Publisher shall release any such withheld sums in respect of such claim; provided, however, that if such claim is subsequently revived, then Publisher shall once again have the right to withhold monies hereunder in respect of such claim. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Publisher shall not withhold any monies pursuant to the immediately preceding sentence if Grantor makes bonding arrangements reasonably satisfactory to Publisher in Publisher's sole discretion, to assure Publisher of reimbursement for all damages, liabilities, costs and expenses (including reasonable actual legal expenses and outside counsel fees) which Publisher may incur as a result of such claim. Notwithstanding the foregoing, with respect to any settlement that is acceptable to Publisher but not Grantor, Grantor shall promptly post a surety bond in a form and in an amount reasonably acceptable to Publisher and reasonably related to the amount of claim at issue, and shall reimburse Publisher for all outside legal fees theretofore incurred by Publisher with respect to such claim. If Grantor fails to do so, Publisher may settle the applicable claim without Grantor's consent and Grantor's indemnity shall apply with full force and effect. Each party shall promptly notify the other in writing of any claim or demand made in respect of one or more Compositions, or any other rights or other claims arising subject to this agreement and the other party shall have the right to participate in any such claim with independent counsel at such party's sole expense.
